metadata.title: CVE-2020-14314 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A memory out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the Linux kernel before5.9-rc2 with the ext3/ext4 file system, in the way it accesses a directorywith broken indexing. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system ifthe directory exists. The highest threat from this vulnerability is tosystem availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1141-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1141.151
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1145-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1145.155
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-193.224').
linux-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-120.122~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1082.91').
linux-aws package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1117.131').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1085.90~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1086.98~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1056.61~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1141.151').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1145.155').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
